add_address_to_env.Description: If true, adds the value of the `address` argument to the Terraform process environment.

address.Description: URL of the root of the target Vault server.

auth_login.Description: Login to vault with an existing auth method using auth/<mount>/login

ca_cert_dir.Description: Path to directory containing CA certificate files to validate the server's certificate.

ca_cert_file.Description: Path to a CA certificate file to validate the server's certificate.

cert_file.Description: Path to a file containing the client certificate.

key_file.Description: Path to a file containing the private key that the certificate was issued for.

headers.Description: The headers to send with each Vault request.

max_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Maximum TTL for secret leases requested by this provider.

max_retries.Description: Maximum number of retries when a 5xx error code is encountered.

max_retries_ccc.Description: Maximum number of retries for Client Controlled Consistency related operations

namespace.Description: The namespace to use. Available only for Vault Enterprise.

skip_child_token.Description: Set this to true to prevent the creation of ephemeral child token used by this provider.

skip_tls_verify.Description: Set this to true only if the target Vault server is an insecure development instance.

token.Description: Token to use to authenticate to Vault.

token_name.Description: Token name to use for creating the Vault child token.

anonymous_group_search.Description: Use anonymous binds when performing LDAP group searches (if true the initial credentials will still be used for the initial connection test).

backend.Description: The mount path for a backend, for example, the path given in "$ vault auth enable -path=my-ad ad".

binddn.Description: Distinguished name of object to bind when performing user and group search.

bindpass.Description: LDAP password for searching for the user DN.

case_sensitive_names.Description: If true, case sensitivity will be used when comparing usernames and groups for matching policies.

certificate.Description: CA certificate to use when verifying LDAP server certificate, must be x509 PEM encoded.

client_tls_cert.Description: Client certificate to provide to the LDAP server, must be x509 PEM encoded.

client_tls_key.Description: Client certificate key to provide to the LDAP server, must be x509 PEM encoded.

default_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Default lease duration for secrets in seconds

deny_null_bind.Description: Denies an unauthenticated LDAP bind request if the user's password is empty; defaults to true

description.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

discoverdn.Description: Use anonymous bind to discover the bind DN of a user.

groupattr.Description: LDAP attribute to follow on objects returned by <groupfilter> in order to enumerate user group membership. Examples: "cn" or "memberOf", etc. Default: cn

groupdn.Description: LDAP search base to use for group membership search (eg: ou=Groups,dc=example,dc=org)

groupfilter.Description: Go template for querying group membership of user. The template can access the following context variables: UserDN, Username Example: (&(objectClass=group)(member:1.2.840.113556.1.4.1941:={{.UserDN}})) Default: (|(memberUid={{.Username}})(member={{.UserDN}})(uniqueMember={{.UserDN}}))

insecure_tls.Description: Skip LDAP server SSL Certificate verification - insecure and not recommended for production use.

last_rotation_tolerance.Description: The number of seconds after a Vault rotation where, if Active Directory shows a later rotation, it should be considered out-of-band.

local.Description: Mark the secrets engine as local-only. Local engines are not replicated or removed by replication.Tolerance duration to use when checking the last rotation time.

max_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Maximum possible lease duration for secrets in seconds.

max_ttl.Description: In seconds, the maximum password time-to-live.

password_policy.Description: Name of the password policy to use to generate passwords.

request_timeout.Description: Timeout, in seconds, for the connection when making requests against the server before returning back an error.

starttls.Description: Issue a StartTLS command after establishing unencrypted connection.

tls_max_version.Description: Maximum TLS version to use. Accepted values are 'tls10', 'tls11', 'tls12' or 'tls13'. Defaults to 'tls12'

tls_min_version.Description: Minimum TLS version to use. Accepted values are 'tls10', 'tls11', 'tls12' or 'tls13'. Defaults to 'tls12'

ttl.Description: In seconds, the default password time-to-live.

url.Description: LDAP URL to connect to (default: ldap://127.0.0.1). Multiple URLs can be specified by concatenating them with commas; they will be tried in-order.

use_pre111_group_cn_behavior.Description: In Vault 1.1.1 a fix for handling group CN values of different cases unfortunately introduced a regression that could cause previously defined groups to not be found due to a change in the resulting name. If set true, the pre-1.1.1 behavior for matching group CNs will be used. This is only needed in some upgrade scenarios for backwards compatibility. It is enabled by default if the config is upgraded but disabled by default on new configurations.

use_token_groups.Description: If true, use the Active Directory tokenGroups constructed attribute of the user to find the group memberships. This will find all security groups including nested ones.

userdn.Description: LDAP domain to use for users (eg: ou=People,dc=example,dc=org)

backend.Description: The mount path for the AD backend.

disable_check_in_enforcement.Description: Disable enforcing that service accounts must be checked in by the entity or client token that checked them out.

max_ttl.Description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, a check-out last with renewal before Vault automatically checks it back in.

name.Description: The name of the set of service accounts.

service_account_names.Description: The names of all the service accounts that can be checked out from this set. These service accounts must already exist in Active Directory.

ttl.Description: The amount of time, in seconds, a single check-out lasts before Vault automatically checks it back in.

backend.Description: The mount path for the AD backend.

last_vault_rotation.Description: Last time Vault rotated this service account's password.

password_last_set.Description: Last time Vault set this service account's password.

service_account_name.Description: The username/logon name for the service account with which this role will be associated.

ttl.Description: In seconds, the default password time-to-live.

backend.Description: Auth backend.

role.Description: Name of the role. Must correspond with the name of the role reflected in the arn.

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

lease_duration.Description: How long the token is valid for.

lease_started.Description: The timestamp the lease started on, as determined by the machine running Terraform.

renewable.Description: Whether the token is renewable or not.

role_id.Description: The RoleID to log in with.

secret_id.Description: The SecretID to log in with.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

bind_secret_id.Description: Whether or not to require secret_id to be present when logging in using this AppRole.

role_id.Description: The RoleID of the role. Autogenerated if not set.

secret_id_bound_cidrs.Description: List of CIDR blocks that can log in using the AppRole.

secret_id_num_uses.Description: Number of times which a particular SecretID can be used to fetch a token from this AppRole, after which the SecretID will expire. Leaving this unset or setting it to 0 will allow unlimited uses.

secret_id_ttl.Description: Number of seconds a SecretID remains valid for.

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

accessor.Description: The unique ID used to access this SecretID.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

cidr_list.Description: List of CIDR blocks that can log in using the SecretID.

secret_id.Description: The SecretID to be managed. If not specified, Vault auto-generates one.

wrapping_ttl.Description: The TTL duration of the wrapped SecretID.

description.Description: Human-friendly description of the audit device.

local.Description: Specifies if the audit device is a local only. Local audit devices are not replicated nor (if a secondary) removed by replication.

options.Description: Configuration options to pass to the audit device itself.

path.Description: Path in which to enable the audit device.

type.Description: Type of the audit device, such as 'file'.

accessor.Description: The accessor of the auth backend

description.Description: The description of the auth backend

local.Description: Specifies if the auth method is local only

path.Description: path to mount the backend. This defaults to the type.

allowed_response_headers.Description: List of headers to whitelist and allowing a plugin to include them in the response.

audit_non_hmac_request_keys.Description: Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the request data object.

audit_non_hmac_response_keys.Description: Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the response data object.

default_lease_ttl.Description: Specifies the default time-to-live duration. This overrides the global default. A value of 0 is equivalent to the system default TTL

listing_visibility.Description: Specifies whether to show this mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint. Valid values are "unauth" or "hidden". If not set, behaves like "hidden".

max_lease_ttl.Description: Specifies the maximum time-to-live duration. This overrides the global default. A value of 0 are equivalent and set to the system max TTL.

passthrough_request_headers.Description: List of headers to whitelist and pass from the request to the backend.

token_type.Description: Specifies the type of tokens that should be returned by the mount.

aws_public_cert.Description: Base64 encoded AWS Public key required to verify PKCS7 signature of the EC2 instance metadata.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

cert_name.Description: Name of the certificate to configure.

type.Description: The type of document that can be verified using the certificate. Must be either "pkcs7" or "identity".

access_key.Description: AWS Access key with permissions to query AWS APIs.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

ec2_endpoint.Description: URL to override the default generated endpoint for making AWS EC2 API calls.

iam_endpoint.Description: URL to override the default generated endpoint for making AWS IAM API calls.

iam_server_id_header_value.Description: The value to require in the X-Vault-AWS-IAM-Server-ID header as part of GetCallerIdentity requests that are used in the iam auth method.

secret_key.Description: AWS Secret key with permissions to query AWS APIs.

sts_endpoint.Description: URL to override the default generated endpoint for making AWS STS API calls.

sts_region.Description: Region to override the default region for making AWS STS API calls.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

disable_periodic_tidy.Description: If true, disables the periodic tidying of the identiy whitelist entries.

safety_buffer.Description: The amount of extra time that must have passed beyond the roletag expiration, before it's removed from backend storage.

accessor.Description: The accessor returned from Vault for this token.

auth_type.Description: The auth method used to generate this token.

backend.Description: AWS Auth Backend to read the token from.

iam_http_request_method.Description: The HTTP method used in the signed request.

iam_request_body.Description: The Base64-encoded body of the signed request.

iam_request_headers.Description: The Base64-encoded, JSON serialized representation of the sts:GetCallerIdentity HTTP request headers.

iam_request_url.Description: The Base64-encoded HTTP URL used in the signed request.

identity.Description: Base64-encoded EC2 instance identity document to authenticate with.

lease_duration.Description: Lease duration in seconds relative to the time in lease_start_time.

lease_start_time.Description: Time at which the lease was read, using the clock of the system where Terraform was running

metadata.Description: The metadata reported by the Vault server.

nonce.Description: The nonce to be used for subsequent login requests.

pkcs7.Description: PKCS7 signature of the identity document to authenticate with, with all newline characters removed.

policies.Description: The policies assigned to this token.

renewable.Description: True if the duration of this lease can be extended through renewal.

role.Description: AWS Auth Role to read the token from.

signature.Description: Base64-encoded SHA256 RSA signature of the instance identtiy document to authenticate with.

allow_instance_migration.Description: When true, allows migration of the underlying instance where the client resides. Use with caution.

auth_type.Description: The auth type permitted for this role.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

bound_account_ids.Description: Only EC2 instances with this account ID in their identity document will be permitted to log in.

bound_ami_ids.Description: Only EC2 instances using this AMI ID will be permitted to log in.

bound_ec2_instance_ids.Description: Only EC2 instances that match this instance ID will be permitted to log in.

bound_iam_instance_profile_arns.Description: Only EC2 instances associated with an IAM instance profile ARN that matches this value will be permitted to log in.

bound_iam_principal_arns.Description: The IAM principal that must be authenticated using the iam auth method.

bound_iam_role_arns.Description: Only EC2 instances that match this IAM role ARN will be permitted to log in.

bound_regions.Description: Only EC2 instances in this region will be permitted to log in.

bound_subnet_ids.Description: Only EC2 instances associated with this subnet ID will be permitted to log in.

bound_vpc_ids.Description: Only EC2 instances associated with this VPC ID will be permitted to log in.

disallow_reauthentication.Description: When true, only allows a single token to be granted per instance ID.

inferred_aws_region.Description: The region to search for the inferred entities in.

inferred_entity_type.Description: The type of inferencing Vault should do.

resolve_aws_unique_ids.Description: Whether or not Vault should resolve the bound_iam_principal_arn to an AWS Unique ID. When true, deleting a principal and recreating it with the same name won't automatically grant the new principal the same roles in Vault that the old principal had.

role_tag.Description: The key of the tag on EC2 instance to use for role tags.

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

allow_instance_migration.Description: Allows migration of the underlying instance where the client resides.

backend.Description: AWS auth backend to read tags from.

disallow_reauthentication.Description: Only allow a single token to be granted per instance ID.

instance_id.Description: Instance ID for which this tag is intended. The created tag can only be used by the instance with the given ID.

max_ttl.Description: The maximum allowed lifetime of tokens issued using this role.

policies.Description: Policies to be associated with the tag.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

disable_periodic_tidy.Description: If true, disables the periodic tidying of the roletag blacklist entries.

safety_buffer.Description: The amount of extra time that must have passed beyond the roletag expiration, before it's removed from backend storage.

account_id.Description: AWS account ID to be associated with STS role.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

sts_role.Description: AWS ARN for STS role to be assumed when interacting with the account specified.

access_key.Description: The AWS Access Key ID to use when generating new credentials.

default_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Default lease duration for secrets in seconds

description.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

iam_endpoint.Description: Specifies a custom HTTP IAM endpoint to use.

max_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Maximum possible lease duration for secrets in seconds

path.Description: Path to mount the backend at.

region.Description: The AWS region to make API calls against. Defaults to us-east-1.

secret_key.Description: The AWS Secret Access Key to use when generating new credentials.

sts_endpoint.Description: Specifies a custom HTTP STS endpoint to use.

username_template.Description: Template describing how dynamic usernames are generated.

backend.Description: The path of the AWS Secret Backend the role belongs to.

default_sts_ttl.Description: The default TTL in seconds for STS credentials. When a TTL is not specified when STS credentials are requested, and a default TTL is specified on the role, then this default TTL will be used. Valid only when credential_type is one of assumed_role or federation_token.

iam_groups.Description: A list of IAM group names. IAM users generated against this vault role will be added to these IAM Groups. For a credential type of assumed_role or federation_token, the policies sent to the corresponding AWS call (sts:AssumeRole or sts:GetFederation) will be the policies from each group in iam_groups combined with the policy_document and policy_arns parameters.

max_sts_ttl.Description: The max allowed TTL in seconds for STS credentials (credentials TTL are capped to max_sts_ttl). Valid only when credential_type is one of assumed_role or federation_token.

policy_arns.Description: ARN for an existing IAM policy the role should use.

policy_document.Description: IAM policy the role should use in JSON format.

role_arns.Description: ARNs of AWS roles allowed to be assumed. Only valid when credential_type is 'assumed_role'

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

client_id.Description: The client id for credentials to query the Azure APIs. Currently read permissions to query compute resources are required.

client_secret.Description: The client secret for credentials to query the Azure APIs

environment.Description: The Azure cloud environment. Valid values: AzurePublicCloud, AzureUSGovernmentCloud, AzureChinaCloud, AzureGermanCloud.

resource.Description: The configured URL for the application registered in Azure Active Directory.

tenant_id.Description: The tenant id for the Azure Active Directory organization.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

bound_group_ids.Description: The list of group ids that login is restricted to.

bound_locations.Description: The list of locations that login is restricted to.

bound_resource_groups.Description: The list of resource groups that login is restricted to.

bound_scale_sets.Description: The list of scale set names that the login is restricted to.

bound_service_principal_ids.Description: The list of Service Principal IDs that login is restricted to.

bound_subscription_ids.Description: The list of subscription IDs that login is restricted to.

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

client_id.Description: The client id for credentials to query the Azure APIs. Currently read permissions to query compute resources are required.

client_secret.Description: The client secret for credentials to query the Azure APIs

description.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

environment.Description: The Azure cloud environment. Valid values: AzurePublicCloud, AzureUSGovernmentCloud, AzureChinaCloud, AzureGermanCloud.

path.Description: Path to mount the backend at.

subscription_id.Description: The subscription id for the Azure Active Directory.

tenant_id.Description: The tenant id for the Azure Active Directory organization.

application_object_id.Description: Application Object ID for an existing service principal that will be used instead of creating dynamic service principals.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

description.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

max_ttl.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

role.Description: Name of the role to create

ttl.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

address.Description: Specifies the address of the Consul instance, provided as "host:port" like "127.0.0.1:8500".

ca_cert.Description: CA certificate to use when verifying Consul server certificate, must be x509 PEM encoded.

client_cert.Description: Client certificate used for Consul's TLS communication, must be x509 PEM encoded and if this is set you need to also set client_key.

client_key.Description: Client key used for Consul's TLS communication, must be x509 PEM encoded and if this is set you need to also set client_cert.

default_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Default lease duration for secrets in seconds

description.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

local.Description: Specifies if the secret backend is local only

max_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Maximum possible lease duration for secrets in seconds

path.Description: Unique name of the Vault Consul mount to configure

scheme.Description: Specifies the URL scheme to use. Defaults to "http".

token.Description: Specifies the Consul ACL token to use. This must be a management type token.

backend.Description: The path of the Consul Secret Backend the role belongs to.

local.Description: Indicates that the token should not be replicated globally and instead be local to the current datacenter.

max_ttl.Description: Maximum TTL for leases associated with this role, in seconds.

name.Description: The name of an existing role against which to create this Consul credential

policies.Description: List of Consul policies to associate with this role

token_type.Description: Specifies the type of token to create when using this role. Valid values are "client" or "management".

ttl.Description: Specifies the TTL for this role.

allowed_roles.Description: A list of roles that are allowed to use this connection.

backend.Description: Unique name of the Vault mount to configure.

cassandra.Description: Connection parameters for the cassandra-database-plugin plugin.

connect_timeout.Description: The number of seconds to use as a connection timeout.

insecure_tls.Description: Whether to skip verification of the server certificate when using TLS.

password.Description: The password to use when authenticating with Cassandra.

pem_bundle.Description: Concatenated PEM blocks containing a certificate and private key; a certificate, private key, and issuing CA certificate; or just a CA certificate.

pem_json.Description: Specifies JSON containing a certificate and private key; a certificate, private key, and issuing CA certificate; or just a CA certificate.

port.Description: The transport port to use to connect to Cassandra.

protocol_version.Description: The CQL protocol version to use.

tls.Description: Whether to use TLS when connecting to Cassandra.

username.Description: The username to use when authenticating with Cassandra.

couchbase.Description: Connection parameters for the couchbase-database-plugin plugin.

base64_pem.Description: Required if `tls` is `true`. Specifies the certificate authority of the Couchbase server, as a PEM certificate that has been base64 encoded.

bucket_name.Description: Required for Couchbase versions prior to 6.5.0. This is only used to verify vault's connection to the server.

hosts.Description: A set of Couchbase URIs to connect to. Must use `couchbases://` scheme if `tls` is `true`.

insecure_tls.Description: Specifies whether to skip verification of the server certificate when using TLS.

password.Description: Specifies the password corresponding to the given username.

tls.Description: Specifies whether to use TLS when connecting to Couchbase.

username.Description: Specifies the username for Vault to use.

username_template.Description: Template describing how dynamic usernames are generated.

data.Description: A map of sensitive data to pass to the endpoint. Useful for templated connection strings.

password.Description: The password to be used in the connection URL

username.Description: The username to be used in the connection URL

hana.Description: Connection parameters for the hana-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

influxdb.Description: Connection parameters for the influxdb-database-plugin plugin.

connect_timeout.Description: The number of seconds to use as a connection timeout.

insecure_tls.Description: Whether to skip verification of the server certificate when using TLS.

password.Description: Specifies the password corresponding to the given username.

pem_bundle.Description: Concatenated PEM blocks containing a certificate and private key; a certificate, private key, and issuing CA certificate; or just a CA certificate.

pem_json.Description: Specifies JSON containing a certificate and private key; a certificate, private key, and issuing CA certificate; or just a CA certificate.

port.Description: The transport port to use to connect to Influxdb.

tls.Description: Whether to use TLS when connecting to Influxdb.

username.Description: Specifies the username to use for superuser access.

username_template.Description: Template describing how dynamic usernames are generated.

mongodb.Description: Connection parameters for the mongodb-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

mongodbatlas.Description: Connection parameters for the mongodbatlas-database-plugin plugin.

private_key.Description: The Private Programmatic API Key used to connect with MongoDB Atlas API.

project_id.Description: The Project ID the Database User should be created within.

public_key.Description: The Public Programmatic API Key used to authenticate with the MongoDB Atlas API.

mssql.Description: Connection parameters for the mssql-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

contained_db.Description: Set to true when the target is a Contained Database, e.g. AzureSQL.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

mysql.Description: Connection parameters for the mysql-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

tls_ca.Description: x509 CA file for validating the certificate presented by the MySQL server. Must be PEM encoded.

tls_certificate_key.Description: x509 certificate for connecting to the database. This must be a PEM encoded version of the private key and the certificate combined.

mysql_aurora.Description: Connection parameters for the mysql-aurora-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

mysql_legacy.Description: Connection parameters for the mysql-legacy-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

mysql_rds.Description: Connection parameters for the mysql-rds-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

oracle.Description: Connection parameters for the oracle-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

postgresql.Description: Connection parameters for the postgresql-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

redshift.Description: Connection parameters for the redshift-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

password.Description: The root credential password used in the connection URL

username.Description: The root credential username used in the connection URL

root_rotation_statements.Description: A list of database statements to be executed to rotate the root user's credentials.

snowflake.Description: Connection parameters for the snowflake-database-plugin plugin.

connection_url.Description: Connection string to use to connect to the database.

max_connection_lifetime.Description: Maximum number of seconds a connection may be reused.

max_idle_connections.Description: Maximum number of idle connections to the database.

max_open_connections.Description: Maximum number of open connections to the database.

password.Description: The root credential password used in the connection URL

username.Description: The root credential username used in the connection URL

verify_connection.Description: Specifies if the connection is verified during initial configuration.

backend.Description: The path of the Database Secret Backend the role belongs to.

creation_statements.Description: Database statements to execute to create and configure a user.

db_name.Description: Database connection to use for this role.

default_ttl.Description: Default TTL for leases associated with this role, in seconds.

max_ttl.Description: Maximum TTL for leases associated with this role, in seconds.

renew_statements.Description: Database statements to execute to renew a user.

revocation_statements.Description: Database statements to execute to revoke a user.

rollback_statements.Description: Database statements to execute to rollback a create operation in the event of an error.

backend.Description: The path of the Database Secret Backend the role belongs to.

db_name.Description: Database connection to use for this role.

name.Description: Unique name for the static role.

rotation_period.Description: The amount of time Vault should wait before rotating the password, in seconds.

rotation_statements.Description: Database statements to execute to rotate the password for the configured database user.

username.Description: The database username that this role corresponds to.

enforcement_level.Description: Enforcement level of Sentinel policy. Can be one of: 'advisory', 'soft-mandatory' or 'hard-mandatory'

paths.Description: List of paths to which the policy will be applied

local.Description: Specifies if the auth method is local only

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

credentials.Description: JSON-encoded credentials to use to connect to GCP

default_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Default lease duration for secrets in seconds

description.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

local.Description: Local mount flag that can be explicitly set to true to enforce local mount in HA environment

max_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Maximum possible lease duration for secrets in seconds

path.Description: Path to mount the backend at.

backend.Description: Path where the GCP secrets engine is mounted.

roles.Description: List of roles to apply to the resource

project.Description: Name of the GCP project that this roleset's service account will belong to.

roleset.Description: Name of the RoleSet to create

secret_type.Description: Type of secret generated for this role set. Defaults to `access_token`. Accepted values: `access_token`, `service_account_key`

service_account_email.Description: Email of the service account created by Vault for this Roleset

token_scopes.Description: List of OAuth scopes to assign to `access_token` secrets generated under this role set (`access_token` role sets only)

backend.Description: Path where the GCP secrets engine is mounted.

roles.Description: List of roles to apply to the resource

secret_type.Description: Type of secret generated for this static account. Defaults to `access_token`. Accepted values: `access_token`, `service_account_key`

service_account_email.Description: Email of the GCP service account.

service_account_project.Description: Project of the GCP Service Account managed by this static account

static_account.Description: Name of the Static Account to create

token_scopes.Description: List of OAuth scopes to assign to `access_token` secrets generated under this static account (`access_token` static accounts only)

disable_delete.Description: Don't attempt to delete the path from Vault if true

disable_read.Description: Don't attempt to read the path from Vault if true; drift won't be detected

ignore_absent_fields.Description: When reading, disregard fields not present in data_json

path.Description: Full path where to the endpoint that will be written

write_data.Description: Map of strings returned by write operation

write_data_json.Description: JSON data returned by write operation

write_fields.Description: Top-level fields returned by write to persist in state

data.Description: Map of strings read from Vault.

delete_all_versions.Description: Only applicable for kv-v2 stores. If set, permanently deletes all versions for the specified key.

disable_read.Description: Don't attempt to read the token from Vault if true; drift won't be detected.

path.Description: Full path where the generic secret will be written.

accessor.Description: The mount accessor related to the auth mount.

base_url.Description: The API endpoint to use. Useful if you are running GitHub Enterprise or an API-compatible authentication server.

description.Description: Specifies the description of the mount. This overrides the current stored value, if any.

organization.Description: The organization users must be part of.

path.Description: Path where the auth backend is mounted

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

allowed_response_headers.Description: List of headers to whitelist and allowing a plugin to include them in the response.

audit_non_hmac_request_keys.Description: Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the request data object.

audit_non_hmac_response_keys.Description: Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the response data object.

default_lease_ttl.Description: Specifies the default time-to-live duration. This overrides the global default. A value of 0 is equivalent to the system default TTL

listing_visibility.Description: Specifies whether to show this mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint. Valid values are "unauth" or "hidden". If not set, behaves like "hidden".

max_lease_ttl.Description: Specifies the maximum time-to-live duration. This overrides the global default. A value of 0 are equivalent and set to the system max TTL.

passthrough_request_headers.Description: List of headers to whitelist and pass from the request to the backend.

token_type.Description: Specifies the type of tokens that should be returned by the mount.

backend.Description: Auth backend to which team mapping will be congigured.

policies.Description: Policies to be assigned to this team.

backend.Description: Auth backend to which user mapping will be congigured.

policies.Description: Policies to be assigned to this user.

disabled.Description: Whether the entity is disabled. Disabled entities' associated tokens cannot be used, but are not revoked.

metadata.Description: Metadata to be associated with the entity.

policies.Description: Policies to be tied to the entity.

canonical_id.Description: ID of the entity to which this is an alias.

custom_metadata.Description: Custom metadata to be associated with this alias.

mount_accessor.Description: Mount accessor to which this alias belongs toMount accessor to which this alias belongs to.

exclusive.Description: Should the resource manage policies exclusively

policies.Description: Policies to be tied to the entity.

external_policies.Description: Manage policies externally through `vault_identity_group_policies`, allows using group ID in assigned policies.

member_entity_ids.Description: Entity IDs to be assigned as group members.

member_group_ids.Description: Group IDs to be assigned as group members.

metadata.Description: Metadata to be associated with the group.

policies.Description: Policies to be tied to the group.

type.Description: Type of the group, internal or external. Defaults to internal.

canonical_id.Description: ID of the group to which this is an alias.

mount_accessor.Description: Mount accessor to which this alias belongs to.

exclusive.Description: Should the resource manage member entity ids exclusively? Beware of race conditions when disabling exclusive management

member_entity_ids.Description: Entity IDs to be assigned as group members.

exclusive.Description: Should the resource manage policies exclusively? Beware of race conditions when disabling exclusive management

policies.Description: Policies to be tied to the group.

issuer.Description: Issuer URL to be used in the iss claim of the token. If not set, Vault's api_addr will be used. The issuer is a case sensitive URL using the https scheme that contains scheme, host, and optionally, port number and path components, but no query or fragment components.

algorithm.Description: Signing algorithm to use. Signing algorithm to use. Allowed values are: RS256 (default), RS384, RS512, ES256, ES384, ES512, EdDSA.

allowed_client_ids.Description: Array of role client ids allowed to use this key for signing. If empty, no roles are allowed. If "*", all roles are allowed.

rotation_period.Description: How often to generate a new signing key in number of seconds

verification_ttl.Description: Controls how long the public portion of a signing key will be available for verification after being rotated in seconds.

allowed_client_id.Description: Role Client ID allowed to use the key for signing.

client_id.Description: The value that will be included in the `aud` field of all the OIDC identity tokens issued by this role

key.Description: A configured named key, the key must already exist.

template.Description: The template string to use for generating tokens. This may be in string-ified JSON or base64 format.

ttl.Description: TTL of the tokens generated against the role in number of seconds.

accessor.Description: The accessor of the JWT auth backend

bound_issuer.Description: The value against which to match the iss claim in a JWT

default_role.Description: The default role to use if none is provided during login

description.Description: The description of the auth backend

jwks_ca_pem.Description: The CA certificate or chain of certificates, in PEM format, to use to validate connections to the JWKS URL. If not set, system certificates are used.

jwks_url.Description: JWKS URL to use to authenticate signatures. Cannot be used with 'oidc_discovery_url' or 'jwt_validation_pubkeys'.

jwt_supported_algs.Description: A list of supported signing algorithms. Defaults to [RS256]

jwt_validation_pubkeys.Description: A list of PEM-encoded public keys to use to authenticate signatures locally. Cannot be used with 'jwks_url' or 'oidc_discovery_url'.

local.Description: Specifies if the auth method is local only

namespace_in_state.Description: Pass namespace in the OIDC state parameter instead of as a separate query parameter. With this setting, the allowed redirect URL(s) in Vault and on the provider side should not contain a namespace query parameter. This means only one redirect URL entry needs to be maintained on the OIDC provider side for all vault namespaces that will be authenticating against it. Defaults to true for new configs.

oidc_discovery_ca_pem.Description: The CA certificate or chain of certificates, in PEM format, to use to validate connections to the OIDC Discovery URL. If not set, system certificates are used

oidc_discovery_url.Description: The OIDC Discovery URL, without any .well-known component (base path). Cannot be used with 'jwks_url' or 'jwt_validation_pubkeys'.

oidc_response_mode.Description: The response mode to be used in the OAuth2 request. Allowed values are 'query' and 'form_post'. Defaults to 'query'. If using Vault namespaces, and oidc_response_mode is 'form_post', then 'namespace_in_state' should be set to false.

oidc_response_types.Description: The response types to request. Allowed values are 'code' and 'id_token'. Defaults to 'code'. Note: 'id_token' may only be used if 'oidc_response_mode' is set to 'form_post'.

path.Description: path to mount the backend

allowed_response_headers.Description: List of headers to whitelist and allowing a plugin to include them in the response.

audit_non_hmac_request_keys.Description: Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the request data object.

audit_non_hmac_response_keys.Description: Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the response data object.

default_lease_ttl.Description: Specifies the default time-to-live duration. This overrides the global default. A value of 0 is equivalent to the system default TTL

listing_visibility.Description: Specifies whether to show this mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint. Valid values are "unauth" or "hidden". If not set, behaves like "hidden".

max_lease_ttl.Description: Specifies the maximum time-to-live duration. This overrides the global default. A value of 0 are equivalent and set to the system max TTL.

passthrough_request_headers.Description: List of headers to whitelist and pass from the request to the backend.

token_type.Description: Specifies the type of tokens that should be returned by the mount.

type.Description: Type of backend. Can be either 'jwt' or 'oidc'

allowed_redirect_uris.Description: The list of allowed values for redirect_uri during OIDC logins.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

bound_audiences.Description: List of aud claims to match against. Any match is sufficient.

bound_claims.Description: Map of claims/values to match against. The expected value may be a single string or a comma-separated string list.

bound_claims_type.Description: How to interpret values in the claims/values map: can be either "string" (exact match) or "glob" (wildcard match).

bound_subject.Description: If set, requires that the sub claim matches this value.

claim_mappings.Description: Map of claims (keys) to be copied to specified metadata fields (values).

clock_skew_leeway.Description: The amount of leeway to add to all claims to account for clock skew, in seconds. Defaults to 60 seconds if set to 0 and can be disabled if set to -1. Only applicable with 'jwt' roles.

disable_bound_claims_parsing.Description: Disable bound claim value parsing. Useful when values contain commas.

expiration_leeway.Description: The amount of leeway to add to expiration (exp) claims to account for clock skew, in seconds. Defaults to 60 seconds if set to 0 and can be disabled if set to -1. Only applicable with 'jwt' roles.

groups_claim.Description: The claim to use to uniquely identify the set of groups to which the user belongs; this will be used as the names for the Identity group aliases created due to a successful login. The claim value must be a list of strings.

not_before_leeway.Description: The amount of leeway to add to not before (nbf) claims to account for clock skew, in seconds. Defaults to 150 seconds if set to 0 and can be disabled if set to -1. Only applicable with 'jwt' roles.

oidc_scopes.Description: List of OIDC scopes to be used with an OIDC role. The standard scope "openid" is automatically included and need not be specified.

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

user_claim.Description: The claim to use to uniquely identify the user; this will be used as the name for the Identity entity alias created due to a successful login.

verbose_oidc_logging.Description: Log received OIDC tokens and claims when debug-level logging is active. Not recommended in production since sensitive information may be present in OIDC responses.

backend.Description: Unique name of the kubernetes backend to configure.

disable_iss_validation.Description: Optional disable JWT issuer validation. Allows to skip ISS validation.

disable_local_ca_jwt.Description: Optional disable defaulting to the local CA cert and service account JWT when running in a Kubernetes pod.

issuer.Description: Optional JWT issuer. If no issuer is specified, kubernetes.io/serviceaccount will be used as the default issuer.

kubernetes_ca_cert.Description: PEM encoded CA cert for use by the TLS client used to talk with the Kubernetes API.

kubernetes_host.Description: Host must be a host string, a host:port pair, or a URL to the base of the Kubernetes API server.

pem_keys.Description: Optional list of PEM-formatted public keys or certificates used to verify the signatures of Kubernetes service account JWTs. If a certificate is given, its public key will be extracted. Not every installation of Kubernetes exposes these keys.

token_reviewer_jwt.Description: A service account JWT used to access the TokenReview API to validate other JWTs during login. If not set the JWT used for login will be used to access the API.

audience.Description: Optional Audience claim to verify in the JWT.

backend.Description: Unique name of the kubernetes backend to configure.

bound_service_account_names.Description: List of service account names able to access this role. If set to `["*"]` all names are allowed, both this and bound_service_account_namespaces can not be "*".

bound_service_account_namespaces.Description: List of namespaces allowed to access this role. If set to `["*"]` all namespaces are allowed, both this and bound_service_account_names can not be set to "*".

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

accessor.Description: The accessor of the LDAP auth backend

local.Description: Specifies if the auth method is local only

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

mount_accessor.Description: The mount to tie this method to for use in automatic mappings. The mapping will use the Name field of Aliases associated with this mount as the username in the mapping.

username_format.Description: A format string for mapping Identity names to MFA method names. Values to substitute should be placed in `{{}}`.

audit_non_hmac_request_keys.Description: Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the request data object.

audit_non_hmac_response_keys.Description: Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the response data object.

default_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Default lease duration for tokens and secrets in seconds

external_entropy_access.Description: Enable the secrets engine to access Vault's external entropy source

local.Description: Local mount flag that can be explicitly set to true to enforce local mount in HA environment

max_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Maximum possible lease duration for tokens and secrets in seconds

options.Description: Specifies mount type specific options that are passed to the backend

path.Description: Where the secret backend will be mounted

seal_wrap.Description: Enable seal wrapping for the mount, causing values stored by the mount to be wrapped by the seal's encryption capability

type.Description: Type of the backend, such as 'aws'

path.Description: Path of the namespace.

address.Description: Specifies the address of the Nomad instance, provided as "protocol://host:port" like "http://127.0.0.1:4646".

backend.Description: The mount path for the Nomad backend.

ca_cert.Description: CA certificate to use when verifying Nomad server certificate, must be x509 PEM encoded.

client_cert.Description: Client certificate used for Nomad's TLS communication, must be x509 PEM encoded and if this is set you need to also set client_key.

client_key.Description: Client key used for Nomad's TLS communication, must be x509 PEM encoded and if this is set you need to also set client_cert.

default_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Default lease duration for secrets in seconds.

description.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

local.Description: Mark the secrets engine as local-only. Local engines are not replicated or removed by replication. Tolerance duration to use when checking the last rotation time.

max_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Maximum possible lease duration for secrets in seconds.

max_token_name_length.Description: Specifies the maximum length to use for the name of the Nomad token generated with Generate Credential. If omitted, 0 is used and ignored, defaulting to the max value allowed by the Nomad version.

max_ttl.Description: Maximum possible lease duration for secrets in seconds.

token.Description: Specifies the Nomad Management token to use.

ttl.Description: Maximum possible lease duration for secrets in seconds.

backend.Description: The mount path for the Nomad backend.

global.Description: Specifies if the token should be global.

policies.Description: Comma separated list of Nomad policies the token is going to be created against. These need to be created beforehand in Nomad.

type.Description: Specifies the type of token to create when using this role. Valid values are "client" or "management".

accessor.Description: The mount accessor related to the auth mount.

base_url.Description: The Okta url. Examples: oktapreview.com, okta.com (default)

bypass_okta_mfa.Description: When true, requests by Okta for a MFA check will be bypassed. This also disallows certain status checks on the account, such as whether the password is expired.

description.Description: The description of the auth backend

policies.Description: Policies to associate with this group

max_ttl.Description: Maximum duration after which authentication will be expired

organization.Description: The Okta organization. This will be the first part of the url https://XXX.okta.com.

path.Description: path to mount the backend

token.Description: The Okta API token. This is required to query Okta for user group membership. If this is not supplied only locally configured groups will be enabled.

ttl.Description: Duration after which authentication will be expired

groups.Description: Groups within the Okta auth backend to associate with this user

policies.Description: Policies to associate with this user

username.Description: Name of the user within Okta

path.Description: Path to the Okta auth backend

policies.Description: Policies to associate with this group

groups.Description: Groups within the Okta auth backend to associate with this user

path.Description: Path to the Okta auth backend

policies.Description: Policies to associate with this user

username.Description: Name of the user within Okta

auto_renew.Description: If enabled, a new certificate will be generated if the expiration is within min_seconds_remaining

backend.Description: The PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.

common_name.Description: CN of the certificate to create.

exclude_cn_from_sans.Description: Flag to exclude CN from SANs.

min_seconds_remaining.Description: Generate a new certificate when the expiration is within this number of seconds

name.Description: Name of the role to create the certificate against.

backend.Description: The PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.

pem_bundle.Description: The key and certificate PEM bundle.

backend.Description: The path of the PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.

crl_distribution_points.Description: Specifies the URL values for the CRL Distribution Points field.

issuing_certificates.Description: Specifies the URL values for the Issuing Certificate field.

ocsp_servers.Description: Specifies the URL values for the OCSP Servers field.

backend.Description: The path of the PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.
The PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.

exclude_cn_from_sans.Description: Flag to exclude CN from SANs.

key_bits.Description: The number of bits to use.

type.Description: Type of intermediate to create. Must be either "exported" or "internal".

backend.Description: The PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.

allow_bare_domains.Description: Flag to allow certificates matching the actual domain.

allow_glob_domains.Description: Flag to allow names containing glob patterns.

allow_localhost.Description: Flag to allow certificates for localhost.

allow_subdomains.Description: Flag to allow certificates matching subdomains.

allowed_domains_template.Description: Flag to indicate that `allowed_domains` specifies a template expression (e.g. {{identity.entity.aliases.<mount accessor>.name}})

backend.Description: The path of the PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.

basic_constraints_valid_for_non_ca.Description: Flag to mark basic constraints valid when issuing non-CA certificates.

client_flag.Description: Flag to specify certificates for client use.

code_signing_flag.Description: Flag to specify certificates for code signing use.

email_protection_flag.Description: Flag to specify certificates for email protection use.

enforce_hostnames.Description: Flag to allow only valid host names

ext_key_usage.Description: Specify the allowed extended key usage constraint on issued certificates.

generate_lease.Description: Flag to generate leases with certificates.

key_bits.Description: The number of bits of generated keys.

key_usage.Description: Specify the allowed key usage constraint on issued certificates.

no_store.Description: Flag to not store certificates in the storage backend.

not_before_duration.Description: Specifies the duration by which to backdate the NotBefore property.

ou.Description: The organization unit of generated certificates.

policy_identifiers.Description: Specify the list of allowed policies IODs.

postal_code.Description: The postal code of generated certificates.

server_flag.Description: Flag to specify certificates for server use.

street_address.Description: The street address of generated certificates.

use_csr_common_name.Description: Flag to use the CN in the CSR.

use_csr_sans.Description: Flag to use the SANs in the CSR.

backend.Description: The PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.

exclude_cn_from_sans.Description: Flag to exclude CN from SANs.

key_bits.Description: The number of bits to use.

max_path_length.Description: The maximum path length to encode in the generated certificate.

permitted_dns_domains.Description: List of domains for which certificates are allowed to be issued.

type.Description: Type of intermediate to create. Must be either "exported" or "internal".

backend.Description: The PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.

exclude_cn_from_sans.Description: Flag to exclude CN from SANs.

max_path_length.Description: The maximum path length to encode in the generated certificate.

permitted_dns_domains.Description: List of domains for which certificates are allowed to be issued.

auto_renew.Description: If enabled, a new certificate will be generated if the expiration is within min_seconds_remaining

backend.Description: The PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.

exclude_cn_from_sans.Description: Flag to exclude CN from SANs.

min_seconds_remaining.Description: Generate a new certificate when the expiration is within this number of seconds

name.Description: Name of the role to create the certificate against.

max_leases.Description: The maximum number of leases to be allowed by the quota rule. The max_leases must be positive.

path.Description: Path of the mount or namespace to apply the quota. A blank path configures a global lease count quota.
Path of the mount or namespace to apply the quota. A blank path configures a global rate limit quota.

rate.Description: The maximum number of requests at any given second to be allowed by the quota rule. The rate must be positive.

default_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Default lease duration for secrets in seconds

description.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

max_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Maximum possible lease duration for secrets in seconds

password.Description: Specifies the RabbitMQ management administrator password

path.Description: The path of the RabbitMQ Secret Backend where the connection should be configured

username.Description: Specifies the RabbitMQ management administrator username

verify_connection.Description: Specifies whether to verify connection URI, username, and password.

backend.Description: The path of the Rabbitmq Secret Backend the role belongs to.

tags.Description: Specifies a comma-separated RabbitMQ management tags.

vhost.Description: Specifies a map of virtual hosts to permissions.

configure.Description: The configure permissions for this vhost.

host.Description: The vhost to set permissions for.

read.Description: The read permissions for this vhost.

write.Description: The write permissions for this vhost.

vhost_topic.Description: Specifies a map of virtual hosts and exchanges to topic permissions. This option requires RabbitMQ 3.7.0 or later.

host.Description: The vhost to set permissions for.

vhost.Description: Specifies a map of virtual hosts to permissions.

read.Description: The read permissions for this vhost.

topic.Description: The vhost to set permissions for.

write.Description: The write permissions for this vhost.

cleanup_dead_servers.Description: Specifies whether to remove dead server nodes periodically or when a new server joins. This requires that min-quorum is also set.

dead_server_last_contact_threshold.Description: Limit the amount of time a server can go without leader contact before being considered failed. This only takes effect when cleanup_dead_servers is set.

last_contact_threshold.Description: Limit the amount of time a server can go without leader contact before being considered unhealthy.

max_trailing_logs.Description: Maximum number of log entries in the Raft log that a server can be behind its leader before being considered unhealthy.

min_quorum.Description: Minimum number of servers allowed in a cluster before autopilot can prune dead servers. This should at least be 3. Applicable only for voting nodes.

server_stabilization_time.Description: Minimum amount of time a server must be stable in the 'healthy' state before being added to the cluster.

aws_s3_bucket.Description: S3 bucket to write snapshots to.

aws_s3_disable_tls.Description: Disable TLS for the S3 endpoint. This should only be used for testing purposes.

aws_s3_enable_kms.Description: Use KMS to encrypt bucket contents.

aws_s3_endpoint.Description: AWS endpoint. This is typically only set when using a non-AWS S3 implementation like Minio.

aws_s3_force_path_style.Description: Use the endpoint/bucket URL style instead of bucket.endpoint.

aws_s3_kms_key.Description: Use named KMS key, when aws_s3_enable_kms=true

aws_s3_server_side_encryption.Description: Use AES256 to encrypt bucket contents.

azure_container_name.Description: Azure container name to write snapshots to.

azure_endpoint.Description: Azure blob storage endpoint. This is typically only set when using a non-Azure implementation like Azurite.

file_prefix.Description: The file or object name of snapshot files will start with this string.

google_disable_tls.Description: Disable TLS for the GCS endpoint.

google_endpoint.Description: GCS endpoint. This is typically only set when using a non-Google GCS implementation like fake-gcs-server.

google_gcs_bucket.Description: GCS bucket to write snapshots to.

google_service_account_key.Description: Google service account key in JSON format.

local_max_space.Description: The maximum space, in bytes, to use for snapshots.

name.Description: Name of the snapshot agent configuration.

path_prefix.Description: The directory or bucket prefix to to use.

retain.Description: How many snapshots are to be kept.

storage_type.Description: What storage service to send snapshots to. One of "local", "azure-blob", "aws-s3", or "google-gcs".

enforcement_level.Description: Enforcement level of Sentinel policy. Can be one of: 'advisory', 'soft-mandatory' or 'hard-mandatory'

backend.Description: The path of the SSH Secret Backend where the CA should be configured

generate_signing_key.Description: Whether Vault should generate the signing key pair internally.

private_key.Description: Private key part the SSH CA key pair; required if generate_signing_key is false.

public_key.Description: Public key part the SSH CA key pair; required if generate_signing_key is false.

address.Description: Specifies the address of the Terraform Cloud instance, provided as "host:port" like "127.0.0.1:8500".

backend.Description: Unique name of the Vault Terraform Cloud mount to configure

base_path.Description: Specifies the base path for the Terraform Cloud or Enterprise API.

default_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Default lease duration for secrets in seconds

description.Description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

max_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Maximum possible lease duration for secrets in seconds

token.Description: Specifies the Terraform Cloud access token to use.

backend.Description: Terraform Cloud secret backend to generate tokens from

lease_id.Description: Associated Vault lease ID, if one exists

organization.Description: Name of the Terraform Cloud or Enterprise organization

team_id.Description: ID of the Terraform Cloud or Enterprise team under organization (e.g., settings/teams/team-xxxxxxxxxxxxx)

token.Description: Terraform Token provided by the Vault backend

token_id.Description: ID of the Terraform Token provided

backend.Description: The path of the Terraform Cloud Secret Backend the role belongs to.

max_ttl.Description: Maximum allowed lease for generated credentials. If not set or set to 0, will use system default.

name.Description: The name of an existing role against which to create this Terraform Cloud credential

organization.Description: Name of the Terraform Cloud or Enterprise organization

team_id.Description: ID of the Terraform Cloud or Enterprise team under organization (e.g., settings/teams/team-xxxxxxxxxxxxx)

ttl.Description: Default lease for generated credentials. If not set or set to 0, will use system default.

user_id.Description: ID of the Terraform Cloud or Enterprise user (e.g., user-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx)

display_name.Description: The display name of the token.

explicit_max_ttl.Description: The explicit max TTL of the token.

no_default_policy.Description: Flag to disable the default policy.

no_parent.Description: Flag to create a token without parent.

num_uses.Description: The number of allowed uses of the token.

renew_min_lease.Description: The minimum lease to renew token.

renewable.Description: Flag to allow the token to be renewed

ttl.Description: The TTL period of the token.

wrapping_ttl.Description: The TTL period of the wrapped token.

allowed_policies.Description: List of allowed policies for given role.

disallowed_policies.Description: List of disallowed policies for given role.

orphan.Description: If true, tokens created against this policy will be orphan tokens.

path_suffix.Description: Tokens created against this role will have the given suffix as part of their path in addition to the role name.

renewable.Description: Whether to disable the ability of the token to be renewed past its initial TTL.

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

allow_plaintext_backup.Description: If set, enables taking backup of named key in the plaintext format. Once set, this cannot be disabled.

backend.Description: The Transit secret backend the resource belongs to.

convergent_encryption.Description: Whether or not to support convergent encryption, where the same plaintext creates the same ciphertext. This requires derived to be set to true.

deletion_allowed.Description: Specifies if the key is allowed to be deleted.

derived.Description: Specifies if key derivation is to be used. If enabled, all encrypt/decrypt requests to this key must provide a context which is used for key derivation.

exportable.Description: Enables keys to be exportable. This allows for all the valid keys in the key ring to be exported. Once set, this cannot be disabled.

keys.Description: List of key versions in the keyring.

latest_version.Description: Latest key version in use in the keyring

min_available_version.Description: Minimum key version available for use.

min_decryption_version.Description: Minimum key version to use for decryption.

min_encryption_version.Description: Minimum key version to use for encryption

name.Description: Name of the encryption key to create.

supports_decryption.Description: Whether or not the key supports decryption, based on key type.

supports_derivation.Description: Whether or not the key supports derivation, based on key type.

supports_encryption.Description: Whether or not the key supports encryption, based on key type.

supports_signing.Description: Whether or not the key supports signing, based on key type.

type.Description: Specifies the type of key to create. The currently-supported types are: aes128-gcm96, aes256-gcm96, chacha20-poly1305, ed25519, ecdsa-p256, ecdsa-p384, ecdsa-p521, rsa-2048, rsa-3072, rsa-4096

backend.Description: The Transit secret backend the resource belongs to.

size.Description: Number of cache entries. A size of 0 mean unlimited.

backend.Description: AD Secret Backend to read credentials from.

last_password.Description: Last known password for the service account.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

accessor.Description: The accessor of the auth backend.

description.Description: The description of the auth backend.

listing_visibility.Description: Specifies whether to show this mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint.

local.Description: Specifies if the auth method is local only

max_lease_ttl_seconds.Description: Maximum possible lease duration in seconds

path.Description: The auth backend mount point.

type.Description: The name of the auth backend.

access_key.Description: AWS access key ID read from Vault.

backend.Description: AWS Secret Backend to read credentials from.

lease_duration.Description: Lease duration in seconds relative to the time in lease_start_time.

lease_renewable.Description: True if the duration of this lease can be extended through renewal.

lease_start_time.Description: Time at which the lease was read, using the clock of the system where Terraform was running

region.Description: Region the read credentials belong to.

role.Description: AWS Secret Role to read credentials from.

role_arn.Description: ARN to use if multiple are available in the role. Required if the role has multiple ARNs.

secret_key.Description: AWS secret key read from Vault.

security_token.Description: AWS security token read from Vault. (Only returned if type is 'sts').

ttl.Description: User specified Time-To-Live for the STS token. Uses the Role defined default_sts_ttl when not specified

type.Description: Type of credentials to read. Must be either 'creds' for Access Key and Secret Key, or 'sts' for STS.

backend.Description: Azure Secret Backend to read credentials from.

client_id.Description: The client id for credentials to query the Azure APIs.

client_secret.Description: The client secret for credentials to query the Azure APIs.

lease_duration.Description: Lease duration in seconds relative to the time in lease_start_time.

lease_renewable.Description: True if the duration of this lease can be extended through renewal.

lease_start_time.Description: Time at which the lease was read, using the clock of the system where Terraform was running

max_cred_validation_seconds.Description: If 'validate_creds' is true, the number of seconds after which to give up validating credentials.

num_seconds_between_tests.Description: If 'validate_creds' is true, the number of seconds to wait between each test of generated credentials.

num_sequential_successes.Description: If 'validate_creds' is true, the number of sequential successes required to validate generated credentials.

role.Description: Azure Secret Role to read credentials from.

validate_creds.Description: Whether generated credentials should be validated before being returned.

backend.Description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

role_id.Description: The RoleID of the GCP auth role.

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

data.Description: Map of strings read from Vault.

data_json.Description: JSON-encoded secret data read from Vault.

lease_duration.Description: Lease duration in seconds relative to the time in lease_start_time.

lease_renewable.Description: True if the duration of this lease can be extended through renewal.

lease_start_time.Description: Time at which the lease was read, using the clock of the system where Terraform was running

path.Description: Full path from which a secret will be read.

alias_mount_accessor.Description: Accessor of the mount to which the alias belongs to. This should be supplied in conjunction with `alias_name`.

alias_name.Description: Name of the alias. This should be supplied in conjunction with `alias_mount_accessor`.

data_json.Description: Entity data from Vault in JSON String form

alias_mount_accessor.Description: Accessor of the mount to which the alias belongs to. This should be supplied in conjunction with `alias_name`.

alias_name.Description: Name of the alias. This should be supplied in conjunction with `alias_mount_accessor`.

data_json.Description: Group data from Vault in JSON String form

backend.Description: Unique name of the kubernetes backend to configure.

disable_iss_validation.Description: Optional disable JWT issuer validation. Allows to skip ISS validation.

disable_local_ca_jwt.Description: Optional disable defaulting to the local CA cert and service account JWT when running in a Kubernetes pod.

issuer.Description: Optional JWT issuer. If no issuer is specified, kubernetes.io/serviceaccount will be used as the default issuer.

kubernetes_ca_cert.Description: PEM encoded CA cert for use by the TLS client used to talk with the Kubernetes API.

kubernetes_host.Description: Host must be a host string, a host:port pair, or a URL to the base of the Kubernetes API server.

pem_keys.Description: Optional list of PEM-formatted public keys or certificates used to verify the signatures of Kubernetes service account JWTs. If a certificate is given, its public key will be extracted. Not every installation of Kubernetes exposes these keys.

audience.Description: Optional Audience claim to verify in the JWT.

backend.Description: Unique name of the kubernetes backend to configure.

bound_service_account_names.Description: List of service account names able to access this role. If set to "*" all names are allowed, both this and bound_service_account_namespaces can not be "*".

bound_service_account_namespaces.Description: List of namespaces allowed to access this role. If set to "*" all namespaces are allowed, both this and bound_service_account_names can not be set to "*".

token_bound_cidrs.Description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.Description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.Description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.Description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.Description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.Description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.Description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

accessor_id.Description: The public identifier for a specific token. It can be used to look up information about a token or to revoke a token.

backend.Description: Nomad secret backend to generate tokens from.

secret_id.Description: Used to make requests to Nomad and should be kept private.

backend.Description: The Transit secret backend the key belongs to.

context.Description: Specifies the context for key derivation

key.Description: Name of the decryption key to use.

backend.Description: The Transit secret backend the key belongs to.

context.Description: Specifies the context for key derivation

key.Description: Name of the encryption key to use.

key_version.Description: The version of the key to use for encryption

plaintext.Description: Map of strings read from Vault.
